newsitem.title: USA: SoCal Edison nuclear unit seen up Friday.
newsitem.headline: SoCal Edison nuclear unit seen up Friday.

text.p: Edison International's Southern California Edison Co expects its 1,080 megawatt (MW) unit 2 at the San Onofre nuclear plant to re-synchronize to the regional grid on Friday, a company spokesman said Wednesday.
The unit will then take another 24 to 72 hours to attain full capacity, said spokesman Ray Golden.
The unit has been down since September 24 for repairs to a leak in the reactor's coolant system.
The San Onofre plant's 1,070 MW unit 3 is scheduled to shut for a 70-day refueling on November 30.
Edison has a 75 percent stake in the San Onofre plant, while San Diego Gas and Electric Co owns 20 percent and two municipal utilities share the remaining five percent.
